Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the increase in average premiums under Obamacare by stating that it has "doubled" across the country.
Understate: The claim understates the limitations and caveats of the report from the Department of Health and Human Services, which focuses only on insurance purchased on the HealthCare.gov exchanges in 39 states.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide additional evidence or data to back up the assertion that premiums have doubled under Obamacare.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in average premiums is solely due to Obamacare, without considering other factors that may have contributed to the increase.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the increase in premiums, such as changes in insurance regulations and coverage requirements, as mentioned in the HHS report.
